Class CustomerDAO

java.lang.Object
customers.CustomerDAO
public class CustomerDAO extends Object
The CustomerDAO class provides methods for managing customer records in an SQLite database. This class implements various methods such as adding, retrieving, updating, and deleting customers, as well as fetching specific customer IDs based on attributes. The `customer` table stores customer details, including their ID, business name, address, telephone number, and email address.
Version:
5/1/2025
Author:
Amrit Singh

  • Method Details

    • findAllCustomers

      public ArrayList<Customer> findAllCustomers()
      Retrieves all customer records from the database.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Customer objects, or an empty list if no records are found

    • findCustomer

      public Customer findCustomer(int customerID)
      Finds a specific customer record by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      customerID - the ID of the customer to retrieve
      Returns:
      the Customer object if found, or null if not found

    • deleteCustomer

      public boolean deleteCustomer(int customerID)
      Deletes a customer record from the database by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      customerID - the ID of the customer to delete
      Returns:
      true if the deletion is successful, false otherwise

    • updateCustomer

      public boolean updateCustomer(Customer customer)
      Updates an existing customer record in the database with new details.
      Parameters:
      customer - the Customer object containing the updated details
      Returns:
      true if the update is successful, false otherwise

    • addCustomer

      public boolean addCustomer(Customer customer)
      Adds a new customer record to the database.
      Parameters:
      customer - the Customer object to be added
      Returns:
      true if the addition is successful, false otherwise

    • getCustomerId

      public int getCustomerId(String businessName, String emailAddress)
      Retrieves the ID of a customer by their business name and email address.
      Parameters:
      businessName - the business name of the customer
      emailAddress - the email address of the customer
      Returns:
      the customer ID if found, or -1 if no matching record is found
